info.title: Ecoindex API
info.description: Ecoindex API enables you to perform ecoindex analysis of given web pages

get.description: This returns a list of ecoindex analysis corresponding to query filters. The results are ordered by ascending date

parameters.description: Start date of the filter elements

schema.title: Date From
schema.description: Start date of the filter elements

parameters.name: date_from

parameters.description: End date of the filter elements

schema.title: Date To
schema.description: End date of the filter elements

parameters.name: date_to

parameters.description: Host name you want to filter

schema.title: Host
schema.description: Host name you want to filter

parameters.name: host

post.description: This performs ecoindex analysis of a given webpage with a defined resolution

schema.title: Web page to analyze defined by its url and its screen resolution

429.description: You have reached the daily limit

example.detail: You have already reached the daily limit of 5 requests for host www.ecoindex.fr today

width.title: Page Width
width.description: Width of the simulated window in pixel

height.title: Page Height
height.description: Height of the simulated window in pixel

size.title: Page size
size.description: Is the size of the page and of the downloaded elements of the page in KB

nodes.title: Page nodes
nodes.description: Is the number of the DOM elements in the page

requests.title: Page requests
requests.description: Is the number of external requests made by the page

grade.title: Ecoindex grade
grade.description: Is the corresponding ecoindex grade of the page (from A to G)

score.title: Ecoindex score
score.description: Is the corresponding ecoindex score of the page (0 to 100)

ges.title: Ecoindex GES equivalent
ges.description: Is the equivalent of greenhouse gases emission (in `gCO2e`) of the page

water.title: Ecoindex Water equivalent
water.description: Is the equivalent water consumption (in `cl`) of the page

page_type.title: Page type
page_type.description: Is the type of the page, based ton the [opengraph type tag](https://ogp.me/#types)

host.title: Web page host
host.description: Host name of the web page

version.title: API version
version.description: Version number of the API used to run the test
